instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
ISL
1-0
2-16.5V
3-4V
9-0
12-3.5V
13-3.48V
14-3.5V
15-0
17-.3V
19-5V
20-5V
27-16.5V
17/18- 2.9 ohms
27/28-20.0 ohms

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>- .28V
diode ppbus G3H to ground - .225V

First bad readings at ISL, replaced got current values, had short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> that appeared later on working on things, replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>/30 and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> one more time.  Values at ISL still same and still no PPBUS G3H

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
0.225 on L7030 is not good, if <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> is original; check diode mode inverting probes too.

Remove F7040 and check voltage at L7030.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
no longer original <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>.

voltage at L7030 is 1V with F7040 removed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Check again diode mode with F7040 removed.
You should get 0.400-500 at L7030, with red probe on ground; OL with black on ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: .518V red to ground and yes OL w/ black to ground

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Replace R/<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
Check all traces and solders around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.
